name: The Westside Nest - Cozy & Convenient!
description: This quaint little townhome is just minutes from shopping, restaurants, grocery stores, parks, MSU campus, hiking trails, downtown and more! Guests can easily access main roads or hop on the Streamline Bus, making visiting local hot spots a breeze. Take a day trip to soak in the nearby hotsprings, explore the caverns, visit Yellowstone, or simply experience the beautiful town of Bozeman, and return home to enjoy all the amenities this cozy home has to offer. Come relax at The Westside Nest!
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a mix of families and young professionals. It's very quiet and laid back. Just down the street is a little park with swings, a jungle gym, basketball court, etc. It's a small neighborhood that seems to be growing every year. A short drive in the other direction are restaurants, the mall, movie theater, grocery store, campus and downtown. The location is very convenient when checking out what Bozeman has to offer!
host_about: Tess is my name and dancing is my game! I'm a Minnesota transplant who found her way to Montana for school and have stayed in the mountains ever since. When traveling, I'm either flanked by my fantastic husband, a group of amazing girlfriends or a handful of crazy family members. I like to relax, check out nightlife, shop and explore fun hot spots when I visit new places. Point me towards the best burger joint in town where I can enjoy live music and a local brew, and I'm a happy camper!

HP#: STR23-00067

Our bright beautiful new luxury apartment (just built in 2017!) will be perfect for your next Bozeman stay. name: Fridley Studio: Downtown on Bozeman's North Side
description:
This is a lovely little standalone studio on Bozeman's Northside. Built in 2004, this studio is clean, tidy, and in great condition.

Located on Wallace Ave and within a few blocks of downtown, it's midway between Wild Crumb and Montana Ale Works.

This is a medium-term rental, with a minimum 30-day stay required. Longterm discounts are negotiable.

FYI: We only list this property on Airbnb. Listings on other online platforms are fraudulent. Beware!
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet old neighborhood of mostly single-family homes. It's a three-block walk to downtown Bozeman.
host_about:
Amy is the Development Program Manager for The Nature Conservancy in Montana. She has also worked as an expedition leader for the eco-tourism company Orbridge, hosting travelers across the western US and on the rivers of Western Europe. 

Amy's husband Chris is the founder of Habitat X, director of the Montana Weatherization Training Center, and an author in the sustainable housing industry.

Amy and Chris live in Bozeman, Montana.

name: West Olive Cottage

host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

This comfy apartment is located on the north side of Bozeman. So close to everything! The fairgrounds are ½ block away. name: Bozeman North 406
description:
Live the Bozeman Lifestyle.
Relax in this farm style home situated in a quaint neighborhood. The inviting front porch welcomes you into the single floor layout. The main bedroom offers a full size bed. The second bedroom offers two large twin beds. Jack and Jill bath, 1/2 bath & Laundry room
It is conveniently located near the historic & vibrant downtown Bozeman Mt.
neighborhood_overview: Make sure you try the neighborhood bakery ~Wild Crumb,  just  around the corner.  The new Story Mill Park is within a few blocks.  Summer in Bozeman offers two Farmers markets, as well as, Lindley park which is  home of the famous Sweet Pea Festival.  Bridger Bowl is a short 20 minute,  breath-taking  drive.   Make sure you take advantage of the trail systems directly behind our beautiful library.  This home is in one of the best locations Bozeman has to offer, especially if you do not want to drive everywhere.
host_about:
I was born and raised under Montana's Big Sky.
I had the good fortune of raising my three beautiful children in the aptly named Paradise Valley.    
I currently live and work in Bozeman, Montana.  I use the trail systems daily, frequent the wonderful restaurants and support my wonderful community. My passions are family, cycling, paddle boarding, kayaking, hiking and camping.  I have traded my skis in for snowshoes

name: Spacious One Bedroom Apartment with Laundry
description: Enjoy all the benefits of home in our comfortable and clean private apartment. Located centrally between Big Sky and Bridger Bowl Ski Areas and situated in the quiet and beautiful neighborhood, Valley West. A quick walk or bike ride will get you to nearby eateries. Just steps out the door are walking and biking trails around a lake.  Air conditioning and eight large windows will keep you comfortable after a day on the trails and radiant floor heat will keep you warm and cozy after the slopes.
neighborhood_overview:
We are located on the west end of Bozeman, near the entrance to Gallitan Canyon. Our street, Alexander, is one block off of Babcock St. A five minute walk to the south will get you to the Market at Ferguson Farms. This a development that has restaurants like, Sidewinders, Tanglewood, Nordic Brew Works and Hachi Sushi Pub. Foxtrot Cafe is located in the middle of the market and it anchors all these stores with an open air feeling and tons of lounge seating and tables. There are also a few boutiques, a reptile store and a grocery store being built as of summer 2023. We also love the Well Juicery, a cold pressed organic juice bar if you’re feeling healthy, or a really nice liquor store and cozy bar called Single Barrel if you’re feeling more spicy!
45 minute drive to Big Sky Resort, 1.5 hours to both the West and North entrance to Yellowstone National Park. Bridger Bowl, 30 minutes.
A quick drive over the pass to Livingston will get you to hotsprings, we love Chico Hotsprings
host_about: My husband, Tucker and I are Bozeman, MT locals. We love living here near family and friends and raising our two children in this beautiful country. Between the four of us we hike, bike, ski and snowboard and have many recommendations for your stay if needed.

description: Remodeled end unit condo, top/2nd floor close to everything!  Located steps from the Galagator/Main St  to Mountains walking/biking trail, the condo has modern updates, furnishings and a deck overlooking a creek.  Loads of natural light and very well appointed. There’s a smart tv in the living room and a Chromecast in the master to stream.  Strong WiFi. 10/30 min bike/walk to downtown (1.25 mi), 5 min walk to MSU & Museum of the Rockies. Cafe, restaurants and fitness studios across the street.
neighborhood_overview: Bike or walk (10/30 min, respectively) along  the beautiful Galligator trail to Main St. Across the street find restaurants , exercise studios, campus and Museum of the Rockies. Loads of hiking/mountain biking, dog friendly parks and trails in the immediate area. Driving distance to downtown is approx 1.25 mi and takes approx 4-5 minutes down historic and charming Willson Ave.  Big Sky Resort, Bridger Bowl and Yellowstone are all within easy driving distance for day trips.
host_about: Traveler, Athlete and current Food Truck owner... living a constant adventure!

description: This brand new apartment in the new sought after area of Bozeman that has spectacular views of the Bridger Mountains and Spanish Peaks. This is the perfect jumping off point for all your Bozeman adventures.  The apartment comes fully furnished with every amenity you want for your stay! neighborhood_overview:
This property sits in the heart of walking trails, biking trails, dog parks, and adventure! This is the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana has to offer. Whether you're here to see Yellowstone, fly fish our famous rivers, ski Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, Mountain Bike up at Hyalite, or just simply enjoying beautiful Bozeman, this is a perfect, safe, kid friendly area!
Ideally located to get to Bridger Bowl within 20 minutes as it is only 19 miles! Big Sky is less than 45 minutes away as it is only 44 miles from our place! The perfect spot for your Skiing and winter vacation!

name: Creekside Cottage on Bozeman Creek

Private deck and access to Bozeman creek which runs all year round.  Walking distance to Montana State University and about 1 mile from historic downtown Bozeman.  Parks as well as hiking and cross country ski trails are located nearby.  Downhill skiing and Yellowstone Park are within driving distance.

name: 4 blocks to MSU or Main St. Cozy & modernized.
description:
Clean, comfortable, modernized historic home. In the Cooper Park neighborhood, near MSU. Blocks from the local Co-op grocery store, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, downtown. Easy 4 block walk to main or MSU. 10-15 minute walk downtown. 25 minute drive to Bridger, 1 hr to Big Sky, 1.5 hrs to Yellowstone.

Bozeman is a mountain town; it’s eclectic with rural feels. Enjoy the local culture of historic and quirky homes near MSU.
neighborhood_overview: Our college neighborhood of Cooper Park is accessible to it all! Walk to the college or downtown, or jog over to Peet's Hill. The food co-op is nearby, as are several restaurants. If you're comfortable with short walks or public transit, no need to rent a car or request a lyft. If you want to stay off your feet, you can get to most areas in 5-10 minutes via car.

name: SoBo Cottage. Easy Downtown Living.
description:
This beautifully renovated 1910 downtown home is the perfect spot for your Montana visit, adventure or staycation.

SoBo Cottage: #STR20-00293

Enjoy a spacious chefs kitchen with heated floors, a soothing queen bedroom w/vaulted ceiling & vanity sink, retro-tiled bathroom, living rm with gas fireplace, warm maple floors and comfy sofa-bed. 1 block south of Main , our landmark revolving horse, vibrant cafes, coffee-shops, boutiques and more are steps away! Includes parking spot.
neighborhood_overview:
SoBo Cottage is located 1 block from the historic Revolving Horse on the corner of Main Street & South Bozeman Avenue. Dozens of restaurants, coffee shops, bakeries, and bars are within walking distance with entertainment, nightlife and shopping minutes from the front door: Farmers Markets - The Emerson, Bogert Park, Fairgrounds; Festivals & Fairs- Sweet Pea, Slam Fest, Gallatin County Fair; Live Theater - The Ellen Theatre, Shakespeare in the Parks, Verge Theater, Bozeman Actors Theater; Live Music - The Rialto, The Ellen, The Elm; Indie Film - The Bozeman Film Society; Music on Main -Enjoy it from our front yard!; Art Walk & Christmas Stroll, plus much more make SoBo Cottage the perfect landing spot to experience Bozeman!

Montana State University is a short drive or a 10 minute walk to the South. The Post Office, Community Food Co-op, Ace Hardware are 1 block away. You simply can't find a place closer to the hub of downtown Bozeman!
host_about: Welcome and thanks for checking out SoBo Cottage! I'm a longtime Bozeman-ite, graduating from Bozeman High and Montana State University after spending my youth traveling the world with my family in the military. I live just a few blocks from SoBo Cottage and am excited to share my home and wonderful community with you!

name: Cozy Apartment in Heart of Downtown!
description: Enjoy this pristine clean, nostalgic 1960s basement apartment in a nice neighborhood within walking distance to midtown and downtown, bike/walking paths, numerous eateries, galleries, and shops.
neighborhood_overview:
This home is in the heart of Bozeman. 9 block walk to Down Town.

Recommended hiking trails:
Sypes Canyon
The "M" Trail
Middle Cottonwood
Hyalite (any hikes)
Drinking Horse
Galligator Trail
Lava Lake
Pete's Hill
Bear Canyon

Recommended Drinking Spots:
Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

The Bozeman Brewing Company. This is a great place to go after a day on the mountain or the river. The patrons are local. The owners and employees are friends. The beer is outstanding.

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

Plonk and the Open Range feature outstanding mixed drinks, wine

name: Comfortable and Modern Bozeman Abode
description: Situated on quiet street in the heart of Bozeman, minutes from downtown, with many options for dining, entertainment & shopping. This lovely place is a great home base!  Go enjoy the surrounding mountains and rivers, experience the Montana life style! Montana summers are fabulous & there are great day trip hikes in every direction. Montana winters are perfect for curling up with a good book … or go play in the snow!  SORRY NO PETS.  Sadly We had to change our policy due to damage.
neighborhood_overview: This house is a 30 minute walk from the central old town area.  There are coffee shops within five minutes walk -Cold Smoke Coffee house - Starbucks etc.  Grocery shopping is also nearby.  Kirk Park is a beautiful park that is two blocks away.
host_about:
Hello fellow travelers!  My husband and I love to travel and we love to stay in Airbnb’s.  
We realized that this is the best way to stay so in 2018 we set up a home in Phoenix  (where we live) so that our kids and our grandkids could have a place to stay when they come visit.  We also have a home in Montana, which is where I am from.  Much of my family still lives in Bozeman so we set up our home away from so we wouldn’t wear out our welcome when we come to visit!  Our Bozeman abode is beautiful and is located in the heart of the town.    We are very glad to be able to share our home away from home airbnb’s with you!

name: Aspen Brook - Immaculate home with mountain views.
description:
Aspen Brook is nestled in an Aspen and Spruce grove near Riverside Country Club. The club's tennis and pickle ball courts provide viewing entertainment off the rear deck, highlighted by the Bridger Range of the Rocky Mountains. A brook with a foot bridge flows between the deck and courts.

This unique offering features two master suites with large bathrooms and walk-ins, along with a third bedroom. The living room boasts a spectacular river rock gas fireplace and luxurious sectional.
neighborhood_overview: Aspen Brook is minutes away from downtown Bozeman, Belgrade, and the Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (BZN).  Bridger Bowl Ski Area is 16 miles away and Big Sky Ski Resort is just under an hour drive away.

name: The Gray Box! Downtown Apartment

Walk to bars, restaurants, and shops. 4 blocks to the Gallatin County Fairgrounds, ice house, and carpool/shuttle lot to nearby Bridger Bowl. 2 miles to MSU campus. neighborhood_overview: We are 5 blocks from downtown Bozeman, close to breweries, cafes, restaurants, and shops. Northeast Bozeman is a great neighborhood that features several parks and hidden gems away from Main Street (including Bozeman Brewing Company!). If you feel like taking a hike, Peet's hill, The M trail, and Drinking Horse trail are all easy to access after a short drive.

name: Guesthouse: 10min walk downtown- Dogs +Cancels OK!
description: Be our guest in our downtown guesthouse! Just 6 blocks to Main Street and downtown Bozeman, our second-story guesthouse has everything you need to enjoy a night or a week in Bozeman. Perfect for a couple, this architect-designed, open-concept studio features radiant floor heating, a full-size bathtub, a washer and dryer, dishwasher, and a 300 sq ft second story outdoor patio.  We are pet friendly (with a fee). Your private backyard space is fenced in and features a charcoal grill.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood is where you want to be in Bozeman. A 15-minute walk or a 5-minute bike ride will get you to every restaurant, shop, or brewery you need to see while you're in Bozeman:
Dave's Sushi, the Coop downtown, Montana Ale Works, Bozeman Brewing Comany, Wild Crumb bakery, Fink's Deli, the Emerson Center for Arts & Culture, Seven Sushi, Wildrye Distillery, Dean's Zesty Booch, Hey Day, Hattie Rex, Ted' Montana Grill, Plonk cocktails, the Bacchus Pub, and Chalet Sports.

If you're heading up to ski at Bridger Bowl, we're on the way. Swing by The Daily Coffee Bar for a latte and a breakfast burrito on your way.

There's plenty of on-street parking in our neighborhood. It's both safe and quiet while still being close to everything.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Main St Bozeman Condo - Walk to Parks & Eateries!
description: Escape to the unique mountainside town of Bozeman, Montana for a memorable getaway! Ideally located in historic downtown, this upscale 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom vacation rental provides easy access to the best attractions. Walk across the street to Lindley Park, check out the Museum of the Rockies, or take a scenic drive to Big Sky Resort for a day on the slopes. After a long day of hiking, fire up the condo's gas grill and admire the Bridger Mountain range from the balcony!

name: Historic Bozeman Hideaway
description:
Enjoy this beautifully restored, one-bedroom, fully-furnished apartment within a house, with its own private entrance. Located in a quiet neighborhood, just a 6 min walk north of Main Street and an 8 min walk to Wild Crumb bakery.

Fully-equipped kitchen with stainless fridge, gas stove, dishwasher, woodblock countertop. Dining room table seats six. High speed wifi. Free onsite parking. Washer/dryer. Great space for reading and relaxing. Wooden floors with Moroccan rugs.

name: Downtown Bungalow - side door
description: Our Downtown Bungalow has the feel of a cottage in a quiet historic downtown neighborhood, two blocks from restaurants, pubs, shops, boutiques, groceries, historic theater, our beautiful library, parks, creeks, and walking trails. It is an ideal location for guests who are traveling through, college bound visitors, professors, students, skiers, bicyclers, families, etc. Guests without transportation are able to get around with ease to downtown, or walking distance to Montana State University.
host_about:
Welcome to Bozeman and our Downtown Bungalow with your own private entrance and lower level floor, two private bedrooms for individuals or groups, one with a queen bed, the other with one full and twin. There is a shared living room and beautiful bathroom with a Europen style shower, a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave, utensils, coffee pot and tea kettle with ground coffee and teas. A bistro table and chairs await you in the garden for your use.
We are located on a quiet street, two blocks from Historic Main Street, restaurants, breweries, coffee shops, boutiques, Bogert Park with their Tuesday night Farmer's Market, a creek, outdoor pool, playground and the base of our amazing trail system from Main Street to the Mountains. We are walking distance to Montana State University, Museum of the Rockies, Bozeman High School, the Community Food Co-op, Bozeman Public Library, Bozeman Deaconess Hospital, and two blocks to our free bus service, including a free downtown shuttle to and from Bridger Bowl Ski Hill.

We are quite the artistic family.
Loretta is a fine artist and educator, muralist, gardener, and bicycler. She exhibits her paintings locally at Cello Gallery and teaches Art Workshops for Adults and children, including Plein Air Landscape Workshops,  Hike Bike Art Camp, plus Art and Sip Parties for all ages and occasions.
Jack is an architectural designer, historian, fine cook, and loves to read. 
He is a skier and hiker of our many local trails.
We love to travel and enjoy exploring nature.
We have two adult children in their twenties.
Our son is a writer and marketer for book publishing. Our daughter is a screen actress.
Our Moto:
Be Active. Explore Nature. Create Art.

-Private balcony off the master
-Guest bedroom with a queen bed
-Upstairs full bath with tub

-Open-plan living room and renovated chef's kitchen

Permit 316716
neighborhood_overview:
The loft is located on the historic south side of Bozeman. It's nestled in a residential community of professionals and students, right around the corner from a park with a playground. It's also:

-5-minute walk to restaurants, a coffee shop, a convenience store, and more
-5-minute walk to the Galligator Trail, the old railway trail that connects Montana State with downtown
-10-minute walk to Museum of the Rockies
-15-minute walk to Bobcat Stadium and 20 minutes to the center of the MSU Campus
-One mile to downtown Bozeman

name: Lindley House
description: Free, fast Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs. Keyless self check-in. Ionizing fogger sterilization between rentals in addition to Covid cleaning protocols to keep you (and us) safe!
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Peach Street Guesthouse | Best Location in BZN
description:
Garden Guesthouse in Bozeman's best neighborhood. Walking distance to downtown. Two blocks away from Bozeman Brewing and Mountains Walking Brewery. Right across the street from Wild Crumb Bakery (best bakery EVER) and Fink's Deli . 20 minute drive to Bridger Bowl Ski Resort so that you can have first tracks! The neighborhood is amazing and authentic. Experience Bozeman like a local.

We have a garden and 4 chickens on the property. They will say hello, you have been warned!
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman's Northside neighborhood has character and attracts local businesses. The best breweries, bakeries, and restaurants around every corner.   The area is quickly transforming into the Arts District. Lots to do right out the front door.
host_about:
Hello there, my name is Emily :)
I live with my partner, Ben.

We love to climb mountains, ski & snowboard, go fishing and get outside as much as we can. Bozeman has access to endless amounts of outdoor recreation, which is one of the main reasons we both ended up in this mountain town.

We are both in the hospitality industry. Ben is a product designer and I am in marketing. 

We are passionate about becoming great hosts and sharing the place that we call home. Please feel free to reach out to us if you have any questions. 

We look forward to having you as our guest! 

Welcome to Bozeman!

neighborhood_overview: Our space is part of the Southbridge Neighborhood in Bozeman right off 19th avenue and very close to Montana State University. It's quiet and very walkable. We have 4 kiddos ourselves and it's perfect for evening strolls and bike rides yet about 15 minutes to down town.

name: Cozy & Luxe "Lagom1Stay" Top Floor Loft Downtown
description: This cozy "Lagom" loft is a well appointed stay. A short walk to downtown Bozeman & MSU. Enjoy the local foodie & shopping scenes. Venture to Yellowstone National Park. Enjoy unforgettable Montana experiences hiking & biking in the mountains or fishing in the rivers. Hit the local world class Big Sky Ski Resort or Bridger Bowl, & soak in local Hot Springs. Retire in luxury & comfort while watching the sun peak over the Mountains from your private balcony. City Hosting Permit Number #STR20-00391
neighborhood_overview:
Enjoy the quieter side of downtown "South-Side" Bozeman, Montana. Nestled in the "Gallatin Valley" surrounded by 7 Mountain ranges! During your stay at the "Cozy Lagom1 SOBO Loft," you will be located in a beautiful & walkable historically established neighborhood with mature trees. Montana State University is right up the road. Take a walk through "MSU" campus to "The Museum of the Rockies" where you may explore early history in the Rocky Mountain Western regions, dinosaur bones, fossils, special exhibits & planetarium shows. "Emerson Cultural Center, Rialto, Elm, & The Willson Auditorium" for performance/concert venues are all short walkable distances away. If you enjoy breezing through the city there are scooters strewn across the town during summer months. Walking distances to parks, playgrounds, & trails. Montana mornings & evenings tend to be on the cooler side no matter what time of year so don't forget to bring clothing options.

In the winter the fun is just beginnin
host_about:
We are Abigail & Eric! We are excited to have you stay! Born & raised Montanans, designer & builder come together to create a beautiful Montana experience just for you.  We are excited to help you navigate Montana & can send a guide on what to bring based on what adventures you plan on having. We have recommendations galore! Want to go skiing, hiking, have day trips, or enjoy fishing? Go out & have an incredible meal, enjoy local walks, & events? We are happy to assist. Montana is truly "Big Sky" country & has the ability to take your breath away. These trips are memories which last. 

Our family enjoys an array of outdoor adventures & love traveling to experience local moments wherever we go. We ski, snowboard, ice-skate, sled, hike, & dip into hot springs. On our hikes we love waterfalls & enjoy sitting around a fire in the mountains sipping on honey tea. Life is a sensory experience & we are thrilled to share these beautiful places we enjoy immensely with you.

name: Immaculate Downtown Bozeman Condo 1 Block off Main
description: Enjoy downtown Bozeman and beyond in this beautiful and cozy Montana Mid-Century Modern condo, a conveniently located 2020 construction only one block from Main! Perfect for couples or the single traveler, you'll have a reserved parking space, a fully-equipped kitchen, high speed WiFi, smart TV with cable, a private balcony to enjoy your morning coffee, convenient 24-7 keyless access from your phone (or a code), and many more amenities as described below. We look forward to welcoming you!
neighborhood_overview:
During your stay, you will be conveniently located in the heart of Bozeman.

Social life can be found less than a block to the north at Bozeman’s legendary “Barmuda Triangle”, a favorite collection of three unique drinking establishments popular among locals and visitors alike - the Molly Brown, the Scoop Bar, and the Haufbrau. (As an aside - the condo sits at the opposite side of the building as this area, so you won’t hear any noises from the famous “Triangle”. Just another perk of this particular unit!).

Also within a stone’s throw north, you can grab a bagel at Bagelworks, a cold treat from Sweet Peaks Ice Cream, or hit up Maven’s Market for some quality cheese and wine.

A few blocks west of the building you will find the Bozeman Co-Op, which offers a host of local and organic groceries in addition to a very popular soup, salad, and entrée buffet. Here you will also find a fine sampling of local beers and wine. If you're in the mood for delicious
host_about:
Ambrose is a front-end web developer, video game developer, and short-story writer. Jill is a software engineer, a violinist for the Bozeman Symphony Orchestra, a private math tutor, and fluent German speaker. We both love meeting new people and sharing the beauty of Bozeman.

As guests, we are respectful of the space, clean and tidy, laid back, and polite. We love exploring new areas,  eating at exotic restaurants, and learning about the local history and architecture. Being hosts ourselves, we are mindful of what goes into hosting and want to make things as easy and pleasant as possible for all parties.

neighborhood_overview: One block from Historic Main Street, Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even

name: Trailer Glamping of Story Hills
description: Welcome to the Trailer Glamper of Story Hills.  The best feature of our 33 ft trailer is the location.  Our property is 3 acres of mountain views and one mile from downtown.  It’s a short walk to local coffee shops, breweries, etc. Access Bozeman's trail system from our gate; Bridger Bowl  is 20 minutes away and MSU is 15 minutes by bike. We have the best of all worlds, a country feel, the amenities of a city, and easy access to wilderness adventures.
neighborhood_overview: We live in the ecclectic and unique Northeast side of Bozeman.  Its not trendy but is well known for the Wild Crumb Bakery, Mountains Walking Brewery, Fink's Deli and other local food trucks. The Story Mill Community Park is just outside our back gate and links you to an amazing trail system that takes you to the Bridger Mountains. Beautiful, historic, downtown Bozeman is one walkable mile away.
host_about: We have lived in Bozeman since 1991; married in 1998; and have owned this property since 2002. This is the place our three kids call home with space enough to ride horses, build snow forts and ski jumps, have huge backyard BBQ's and bonfires. Troy comes from an entrepreneurial background including the fitness business, film industry, insurance, and communication coaching. Lei-Anna has been in public education and currently consults with and travels to school districts around the country. We have a deep love and respect for the wilderness that surrounds us, the Greater Yellowstone, in addition to exercise, meditation, and a belief in a healthy organic and sustainable lifestyle.

description: Come be one of the first to stay at our 4Q2020 Bozeman Bungalow just minutes from Montana State University. neighborhood_overview: Our side of the street is the only part of the neighborhood zoned for vacation rentals so most neighbors are quiet full time residents. Feel free to take a growler or two to fill at one of our local craft breweries:

Bridger Brewing is across town on campus and also one of our favorites. The pizza at Bridger Brewing is excellent.

MAP brewing is a great place to have a beer.

The dive bars are The Filler, The Eagles, The Crystal, and The Hauf. Each often feature live music. The Hauf has live music nightly.

Plonk and the Open Range feature outstanding mixed drinks, wine and beer imports.

name: Bozeman 303: Your Bozeman Basecamp!
description:
Welcome to Your Bozeman basecamp! Whether your outdoor adventure is hiking, skiing, or fishing, everything is within reach; including Big Sky Resort and Yellowstone National Park. Here for business, you found the perfect place. Our beautiful and efficient condo is a 15 minute drive from Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport, 60 minutes from Big Sky, 20 minutes from Bridger Bowl and steps away from Montana State University, great local shops, restaurants and grocery stores.

STR20-00399
neighborhood_overview: Nestled into one of Bozeman's iconic craftsman style neighborhoods from the early 1900's and just two blocks from both it's historic downtown and local food markets, Bozeman 303 is the perfect location. Hiking trails, world class skiing, natural hot springs and Yellowstone National Park are all just a short drive away.  Bozeman offers a wide variety of dining and shopping experiences. Whether you enjoy upscale or casual dining, a local microbrew from one of our 12 breweries or a hand crafted cocktail, downtown Bozeman has exactly what you are looking for. Seeking local art, antiques or books? How about gear for your next adventure? The shopping scene in Bozeman does not disappoint.

name: Bozeman Retreat - Clean, Comfortable, Downtown
description: The Bozeman Retreat is just seven blocks from downtown and only a few blocks from midtown Bozeman. This new highly efficient contemporary home features a full kitchen, local TV, Roku, WiFi, stereo with Bluetooth, keyless entry, washer, dryer, coffee maker, filtered water, in-floor heat, new appliances, and welcoming decor. Guests will sleep well on a medium-profile hybrid mattress combining the benefits of a traditional innerspring with a thick layer of cushioning memory foam. There is plenty of parking and the retreat is easy to get to and from wherever your travels might take you.
neighborhood_overview: The Bozeman Retreat is in the 'old' or original part of Bozeman. Homes in this area are a mix of original homes that were built in the 1930's to new homes like the Retreat. There is an elementary school a few blocks to the west. Downtown is five to seven blocks away. Bozeman's Midtown is five blocks away. The street is quiet with really not much more traffic than residential.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: The Cowboy Inn - Downtown Bozeman
description:
The Cowboy Inn, located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk (or drive) to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. Enjoy this newly built condo, with contemporary and stylish amenities. Welcome to Bozeman, "the most livable town."
STR23-00064
neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities.

Enjoy the nearby hot springs, ski hills, trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)
25 min to Livingston
50 min to Big Sky
15 min to Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport

name: Smack Dab in the Middle of Bozeman!
description:
Here in the Heart of Bozeman life can be whatever you want: quiet and simple or exciting and adventurous--all in the same day!
Whether you're on vacation or working in the valley, we've outfitted our home to be YOUR home while you're here. We are excited to welcome you to Bozeman, and to invite you to enjoy all this beautiful area has to offer!
neighborhood_overview:
The Walton Homestead subdivision is a quiet and inviting neighborhood with a family-friendly atmosphere and views of the Bridger Mountains. The yard and an open space behind the house gives kids and four-legged friends a place to stretch their legs and there's a full park and playground less than one block away. (Note: the yard is NOT fenced.)
Being at almost the exact geographic center of Bozeman, you'll be minutes away from everything: shopping, groceries, fine dining, fast food, the Gallatin Valley Mall, gyms, hiking (at multiple regional parks within city limits,) coffee shops, bars, cinemas, live theater, music venues, spas and salons, bowling, the Bozeman Swim Center, the Bozeman Beach, churches, not to mention the real reason so many people want to visit Bozeman--the skiing, fishing, golfing, hiking, camping, climbing and dozens of other outdoor activities the people of this town love so much!

name: The Granny Flat
description:
Bright, spacious and clean 1 BR/1BA guesthouse. Complete with all amenities needed for a relaxing getaway, including king size Tuft and Needle bed (comfort heavily noted in our reviews), washer/dryer, Roku TV, high speed internet, and well equipped kitchen.

Short distance to West Side restaurants or downtown shops. Multiple nearby parks and ponds.

Apartment is over detached garage with an independent door leading to an enclosed stairwell.
neighborhood_overview:
Flanders Mill is a newer neighborhood on the west side of town. Wide sidewalks welcome you to take a nice walk or jog. Take a lap to one of the many parks both in and around the neighborhood. The Gallatin County Regional park is just a block away with a large fenced in dog park, a couple lakes, a kid friendly playground and additional walking paths.

If you're looking for a good meal, look no further than the The Market at Ferguson Farm, where you're sure to find something for everyone. A walk-able or bike-able dining and retail experience just a couple blocks south of the apartment.

name: Parks, trails and open spaces!
description: Come stay a couple days or a couple weeks. Lots of space indoors and out. Beautiful views of the mountains, big skies and urban open spaces. Magnificent sunrises and sunsets. Whether you are here to enjoy or here to work, this is the spot for you. We are nestled in a burb easily accessed from I90, but far enough away for peace and tranquility. The Streamline bus stop is just 3 blocks away for easy access to public transportation to downtown or other local destinations. License # STR21-00004
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in the northwest part of town. Our little burb is quite active. You'll see people walking, running or biking the trail all day. The playground is down our street 2 blocks to the south and the basketball courts are another 2 blocks past the basketball courts.

Don't worry if you forgot something at home. We have groceries, outdoor gear, beauty supplies, crafts, gaming, etc. within a 10 minute walk.

name: Sweet Little Bungalow -  Full of Plants and Light
description:
Cute small home right by the Linear Trail and close walking distance to downtown and campus. Single level,​ full of sunlight​,​ plants​,​ and beautiful textiles. There is a shared washer and drier with the downstairs tenant. The home has wood floors​,​ a bathtub​,​ a blooming lemon tree​,​ and a backyard garden - but no dishwasher​,​ microwave or TV.

House is only available for stays longer than 30 days.

name: 1 Bedroom Apartment with Spectacular Views
description:
Cozy apartment in Bozeman with spectacular mountain views. Close access to hiking, skiing, fishing, and everything else that brings you to Montana!

Apartments includes fully furnished kitchen, single bedroom with dresser and closet, full bathroom, free wash/dryer, WIFI, and TV with streaming apps.

Photos were taken shortly after completion. All windows other than the stairway have blinds installed.

We are available for any questions you have about your stay via call, text, or email.
neighborhood_overview: Centrally located neighborhood with streams, ponds, parks, and walking trails.  Minutes from hiking and <60 minutes from great skiing and fishing.

name: Downtown Bozeman Birdhouse
description: Central AC, Free, fast 400 Meg Ultra Spectrum Wifi*** Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Chic Bozeman Apartment - 1 Block Off West Main St!
description: Nestled in the heart of Bozeman and featuring bright, welcoming style, this 1-bedroom, 1-bath apartment will host your next stay with ease! The vacation rental boasts multiple walkable restaurants, while a short drive will bring you to Montana State University, the Museum of the Rockies, and much more if you stay in town. Hop in the car to access Rocky Mountain fun in Yellowstone National Park, Bridger Bowl Ski Area, and Big Sky Resort, not to mention hiking in Custer Gallatin National Forest!

name: Homey Stay on Hoover Way Bozeman, MT!
description: Charming townhouse with 3 bedrooms and 2.5 baths in Beautiful Bozeman. Overlooks walking path and pond in a quiet neighborhood. Conveniently located less than a mile from Shopping, fuel and Restaurants.  Less than 10 minute drive to Bobcat Stadium, 30 minutes to Bridger Bowl and 15 minutes to BZN Airport with easy access to I-90! Quick trip for fishing, hot springs, camping and Big Sky Ski Resort. name: Valley west Condo
description:
Enjoy your Big Sky stay in Bozeman, MT!

This condo is located in the lovely Valley West subdivision, short drive from downtown, walking distance to the neighborhood park and pond plus THE MARKET which has some of the most popular restaurants in town.
Wifi and parking are included.

You’ll be close to everything in Bozeman but far enough to enjoy a relaxing trip. We are local to the area so we know all the good spots for freshly brewed coffee, great hikes and best brew in town.

name: The Fox Den in Downtown Bozeman

Come enjoy the ideal base camp: our newly-built, well-appointed condo located within easy walking distance to downtown Bozeman, a cozy fox den nestled in Montana's natural beauty.

The condo has an upscale, well-stocked gourmet kitchen, an over-size shower, and luxury finishes. Enjoy your view of the Bridger Mountains from your large private deck and balcony.

name: Beall Street Bungalow-3 blocks to downtown center
description: Welcome to Bozeman MT where skiing, fishing, hiking, and Yellowstone National Park are at your fingertips.  And if you are staying in Bozeman then why not stay steps from where all the buzz happens?  Our 1 bedroom with a king size bed, a Murphy pullout in the living room, and 1 bath house is located 3 blocks from the center of downtown.  Perfect for a couple or a traveling family. We are just steps away from restaurants, boutiques, coffee shops, theaters, and great bars.
neighborhood_overview: When visiting Bozeman there really is no better place to stay then right in the heart of downtown. Your house is 3 blocks away to the center of the downtown. There are so many great restaurants, boutiques, art galleries, coffee shops, beauty, and nightlife right around the corner from your location on Main Street. Nine blocks the other way gives you access to the shuttle that will take you directly to the ski area at Bridger Bowl.  You will also find a big park located just a block away. Whether you are here for the skiing, hiking, fishing, or visit to Yellowstone you will find our location a great base area for all your fun!

name: Downtown Villa
description: Prime Downtown Location  --  Free, fast Spectrum Wi-Fi for remote learning/working needs  ---   Keyless self check-in. Heated floors throughout.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Downtown Bozeman Western Cottage
description: Enjoy this log home in Bozeman’s most soulful neighborhood.  Walkable to the famous Wild Crumb Bakery, Treeline Cafe, Mountains Walking Brewery, and Downtown Bozeman.  This 1940s traditional Montana cottage is the perfect retreat to experience life like a local.  Backyard, private parking, and a safe neighborhood will help you rest easy at night.
neighborhood_overview: We may be a bit biased, but we think our house boasts the absolute best location in all of Bozeman. Within a 5 minute walk of our home is an incredible bakery (Wild Crumb), the best coffee the city has to offer (Treeline), many great breweries, restaurants,  bars, the main street of town with cute shops, and trails galore webbing out from the Bozeman Public Library (yup,our library moonlights as a trailhead!) Despite being so close to everything,  the house is on an incredibly quiet street, nestled amongst other charming homes.
host_about:
Some numbers: In the (12) years I’ve been a member of the AirBnB community, I've stayed in over (100) AirBnBs across (6) continents, rented out (5) of my living spaces while traveling, and met my (1)  husband while staying in his AirBnB.  

To say I love this platform is an understatement.  It has fundamentally changed how I navigate the world and provides me with the freedom to see more of it.

I aim to be the best host you've ever had because I understand first hand how important accommodation is to a great experience on the road. 

I aim to be the best guest you've ever had because I understand how personal it is to open up your home to travelers.

name: ADU208: Immaculate 1-bedroom downtown ADU
description: Unwind in the sizable comforts of this small modern space.
neighborhood_overview: ADU208 is five blocks from the center of downtown Bozeman. It is four blocks from the heart of Bozeman's Northeast Neighborhood.
host_about:
Hi. My name is Reno Walsh. I am the owner of Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals. 

I sincerely appreciate Bozeman, Montana. I moved here in 1995 and immediately launched a career in the tourism industry. I met my wife to be on the summit of Saddle Peak in the Bridger Mountain Range just outside of town and a few years later I proposed to her in a raft on Montana’s Smith River. We were married downtown Bozeman at Lindley Park. Today we are the proud parents of two living in our own home on Bozeman’s northeast side. I’m an active volunteer and leader in the community. I’m the owner of a successful short-term rental and long-term downtown Bozeman vacation rental on North Montana Ave.

Bozeman Montana Vacation Rentals understands the importance of excellent customer service. I’ve guided thousands of guests around the world on active vacations. I’ve hosted thousands at food, wine, and beer conferences around the world. And, we have hosted over a thousand guests at our vacation rentals. Guests trust us and consistently rate their experience at the highest level.

name: Western Magic - 3 Bedroom + Office Bozeman Condo
description: Western Magic is a spacious condo with 3 bedrooms, a fully equipped remote office with standup desk, supplies, & printer, and a fully stocked kitchen - to make the most of your Bozeman getaway. Enjoy a covered front patio for entertaining and relaxing, and a back patio for grilling with a large gas grill.  Located on the west edge of Bozeman, with views of the Bridgers and easy access to Big Sky or Bridger Bowl skiing, fly fishing, trails, downtown, and major stores. Family-friendly. No pets.
neighborhood_overview: This is a suburban neighborhood on the west side of Bozeman, with plenty of green space and walking trails close by that you can walk to from the condo. There is a lovely park a block away with a kids play area, and 4 blocks away is a set of walking/biking trails around 2 small "lakes", a larger kids play area and a picnic pavilion. Look out for Osprey dive bombing for fish in these lakes! Yes, you can fish in them. The neighborhood is a mix of families, students, and professionals. Be sure to drive slowly on the streets and be alert as there are joyful young kids who play outside in the neighborhood.
host_about:
Adventure mom, strategic marketer, sustainability & geotourism advocate.  I have 2 homes I rent when I am not in them, in Western North Carolina and in Bozeman, Montana. I know the WNC area around Bryson City, Nantahala Gorge, Sylva, Cherokee and across the park into Gatlinburg very well.  I also know the Bozeman and Greater Yellowstone Valley quite well after more than a decade of living there. I am a keen skier - alpine, telemark, xc classic and xc skate  as well as a fly fisherwoman, hiker, and biker. I love to help others find the right adventure activities, and places to go and see, for your vacation success.  

Hiking, float trips, white water rafting, lake paddling, waterfalls, mountain biking trails, best roads for road biking, best motorcycle touring roads, best skiing and rivers to fish are all things I'd love to help you find! Am very kid-centric, so am happy to be a great resource for the best things to do with kids from tiny tots to adventure loving teens.  I run an adventure tourism and travel marketing agency, so helping others find big and small adventures in cool places is in my DNA.

name: Private 2 Bedroom Suite - Near Downtown & MSU
description:
Base your Bozeman stay at our private, clean, cozy, bright, and convenient 2 queen bedroom/1 bath BASEMENT suite in our 1950s home near Downtown and MSU. We can host up to 4 guests. 2 desks, WiFi, 2 Smart Roku TVs, laundry, linens & toiletries. Efficient kitchen and dining area.
Off street parking and separate guest entrance with keypad.
Near restaurants, breweries, coffee shops and more!
Minutes to downtown 5, MSU 5, Bridger Bowl 25, Big Sky 55, BZN airport 20.
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet, safe, centrally located residential neighborhood with quick access to Downtown, MSU, the interstate and the airport.

Cooper Park and the MSU campus are just a short walk away.

Grocery: There are 3 grocery stores (Safeway, Albertsons, Town n Country) ~3/4 of a mile away and the Community Food Coop is a 12 min walk/2 min drive away.
Pharmacy: CVS, Safeway and Osco pharmacies are nearby if you need medications or incedentals.
host_about:
Sarah and I love living in Bozeman but also like to travel and adventure throughout the western US and the world, often on bikes. At home we spend our free time outdoors hiking, running, riding mountain and gravel bikes in the summer and nordic skiing, snow biking, and ice climbing in the winter. When traveling we prioritize exploration and adventures.

As hosts we welcome you and try hard to provide a clean, comfortable, convenient, and affordable base for your Bozeman visit and adventures. We are happy to share years of local knowledge about fun things to do in the Bozeman area including hiking, skiing, backpacking, ice climbing, mountain-biking, visiting Yellowstone National Park, and places to shop or eat around town.

name: King Bed, Workstation, & Fast WiFi
description:
Digital Nomad Dream Apartment

This 1 bedroom / 1 bath apartment is right smack dab in the middle of Bozeman. 1.2 miles to Downtown, 3.4 miles to the hospital, 17 miles to Bridger Bowl, and 44 miles to Big Sky

100mbps WiFi + desk & ergonomic chair + 21" Monitor with HDMI port

host_about:
Hi there! My name is Cooper and I grew up in the lowcountry of South Carolina. I developed a love for the outdoors at a very young age and enjoy hiking, mountain biking, and anything on the water. 

I work remote for a software company you have probably used before and love the flexibility it gives me in terms of work locations / home offices. I have been to 32+ countries and want to keep adding to my list. What is your favorite country? 

When I travel I prefer to stay for longer visits to spread my roots into the local communities. 28+ day stays are my speciality so all of my units are equipped for mid term stays. Think standup desks, fast wifi, everything you need to cook, and welcoming spaces.

Making sure you have a smooth check in and the ability to ask any questions during your stay is my #1 priority.

name: **Downtown Bozeman Historic Main Street Condo**
description: On Historic Main Street, this charming condo with alley access includes: a LED fireplace, granite countertops, stainless steel appliances, fully stocked kitchen, Smart TV with surround sound, at home work station, air exchange system bringing fresh air to the windowless basement, and pictures galore providing a picturesque motif of The Speak Easy Era.  Be a local in Downtown Bozeman enjoying the luxury of walking to your favorite restaurant, coffee house, park, cultural center and music venues!
neighborhood_overview:
Be a local and walk from your new home in Historic Downtown Bozeman to the many sights, eateries, and museums lining Main Street: Jam Eatery, Tree Line Coffee, Emerson Cultural Center, Ellen Theater, Gallatin History Museum, Rialto Music Venue, Bozeman Food Co-op, LuLulemon, Country Book Shelf, Schnees Shoes, Black Bird Kitchen, Theory Hair Salon, The Market Place, Backcountry Burger Bar and The Bozeman Public Library. Bozeman is where new vogue culture meets legendary history. Take it all in by living in the heart of what John Bozeman found so intriguing years ago.

Ready for an adventure? Rent a bike from Owenhouse Cycling and ride from Downtown on the Gallagator Trail south to The Museum of the Rockies and meet the local dinosaurs! Next, cycle around Montana State University to see what all the hype is about!! Then back home through the south side neighborhoods looking for the Historical Register lawn signs telling the tales of the old houses along the tree lined stree

host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: New!  Wonderful location! The Amble on Inn.
description: Winter is the  best time to visit Montana.  Light fluffy snow for a winter delight.  Ski the powder.   Bridger bowl is less than 20 miles away.  Our well appointed condo is centrally located in Midtown Bozeman. Right off Main Street and North 7th Ave.  Clean and uncluttered, There is an in suite washer and dryer. Walking our Main Street is always a pleasure.
host_about: A little about myself,  I spent 20 years as a designer and three years as an Art Educator for k-12.    For recreation, I love to cycle.  I feel like flying when I am on a bike.  Something about the wind in my face, the aroma of the surroundings, and the sweat on my brow. I love the view when cycling down the open road.  I love visiting new vacation homes, it is wonderful to see what each host offers.  I decided to set up an airbnb to host travelers coming to my area.  I grew up in The Gallatin Valley on the river and Graduated from Montana State University.    "Living life with creative zeal".  Laura Jean

name: South Bozeman Betty
description: Bring family and friends to enjoy and experience a bohemian eclectic treasure just two and a half blocks south of downtown Bozeman. Free/fast Wi-Fi. Hot tub. Keyless self check-in.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Luxury Bozeman, Montana Cottage Rental
description:
In order to truly experience Bozeman and the abundance of attractions that make Montana "the most livable place", we would love for you to visit and even stay a while! Welcome to The Cottage: a luxury free standing condo offering both nightly and 30+ day stays, just minutes from downtown Bozeman with shopping and nightlife.

The Cottage was built with opulence, functionalism and attention to detail at the core of every design decision. A home away from home, the Lux Cottage is waiting for you.
host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

name: Modern Downtown Condo, block off Main Street!
description: This newly-built condo is exactly where you want to stay to get the full Bozeman experience! A short walk away from Main Street's highly rated restaurants and eclectic local shops. Close to Montana State University, making it easy to hop on a tour or explore the campus yourself. If you’re wanting to explore the Big Sky Country, this condo is a short drive from the outdoors and a has all the comforts of home when you’re ready to relax. Also, a perfect setup to work remotely.
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Bozeman is home to hundreds of thriving retailers, restaurants, and professional services. Bozeman and the entire greater Yellowstone region have so much to offer visitors. The quality of experiences enjoyed in Bozeman is largely determined by its amazing mountain setting which provides endless outdoor recreation opportunities. From skiing in the winter to fishing and hiking in the summer, Bozeman is a fabulous basecamp for exploring all that Southwest Montana has to offer. For being a small mountain town, Bozeman has a surprisingly impressive culinary scene. No matter what budget you're on or how picky you are, there are options for everyone, and the variety is growing by the day. Bozeman has every tasty bite you can imagine, from southern fried chicken to Korean bibimbap; from wood-fired pizza to fresh poke burritos. Bozeman is very fortunate to have a thriving arts and culture community. Highlights include our new “green” public library and the world-renowned Museum of the
host_about:
I am a working professional who works from home. I live in Bozeman, Montana for part of the year and rent my condo there out and travel frequently. 
I love living in Bozeman because of the natural beauty of Montana and the variety of outdoor activities that can be done year round with few crowds. Also, Bozeman has a friendly small mountain town feel with city conveniences including access to great restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. I am originally from Chicago and enjoy skiing, hiking, and riding a crossover motorcycle.

name: Blue Hem on Bozeman 1-Month Min
description: 3 Blocks from the core of Downtown Bozeman with central AC plus a separate studio space with kitchenette and bathroom. Nightly price ranges from 175/night I’m off season to 225/night summer and holiday season.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Garden Basement Apartment
description:
Our cozy apartment is in an ideal location just blocks from Montana State University and downtown Bozeman.

Whether you are traveling to Bozeman for work or adventure, it is the perfect home base. With a beautiful shared backyard, a park just one block away, and the Gallagator trail two blocks away, our home is a great place to experience all that Bozeman has to offer. Enjoy your stay in this cozy apartment, equipped with all of the comforts of home.
host_about:
My husband and I are born and raised here in Montana. We love all of the hiking, skiing and biking that this area has to offer. We also love enjoying the many National Parks in our state. 

Montana is for us, one of the best places and we hope that anyone who stays in our home will agree!

name: Bozeman Bungalow Downtown
description: Two blocks off the heart of historic Main St. in downtown Bozeman. Newly remodeled, one bedroom guest house with private fenced patio/small yard*,  full kitchen, sleeper couch, w/d. Pets are welcome with approval. Easy walking distance to epic restaurants, breweries and shopping. Less than 5 minutes to MSU and hiking trails. 10 mins to the airport. 15 mins to Bridger Bowl Ski Hill. 20 mins to world-class flyfishing. Use of 2 cruiser bicycles included.
neighborhood_overview: Charming neighborhood two blocks off Main St.
host_about: Lived in Bozeman, MT for 30 years, now in Livingston for three, originally from Texas.  Two adult daughters.  Love the outdoors, motorcycling, flyfishing, floating, paddleboarding, kayaking, animals to name a few.  Authored "The No Nonsense Guide to Flyfishing Montana".

name: New Chalet/Mins to Downtown/MSU/Hike/Fish/Ski
description:
"Awesome host, location and lodging!" -Seth

• Recently renovated chalet
• Sleeps 2 to 4 with queen bed & queen pullout sofa
• Full kitchen with breakfast bar
• Private bathroom with shower
• Dedicated workspace
• In-unit laundry and supplies
• Close to downtown & MSU
• Easy access to fishing, skiing, Yellowstone National Park, as well as hiking
and biking trails
• Half a block from large park and lake
• Book your escape and stay in this modern and homey chalet

Hosting Permit: STR23-00020
neighborhood_overview:
This delightful Montana apartment for 4 is located in an upscale neighborhood of Bozeman. It’s a quiet and pleasant location that’s ideal for families or couples to escape to for a weekend, week, or longer, and for remote workers looking for somewhere to base themselves in Montana.

The property sits in the heart of walking & biking trails, parks, and all kinds of outdoor adventures, making it the perfect basecamp for getting out and seeing all that Bozeman and Montana have to offer on foot, bikes or by car.

Nearby places you might be interested in checking out during your stay include:

Yellowstone National Park - always a big attraction for people from all over the world with views, trails and landscapes you’ll remember for a lifetime.

Montana State University - the largest university in the state is close by, so if you’re a student or parents of a student looking to study here, the chalet is a great place to base yourselves while you’re chec
host_about:
I am a 30-something local resident of Bozeman, MT where I live and work as a VP at a digital transformation agency. 

I love traveling and spending time with my friends and family.  I enjoy all outdoor activities, hiking, backpacking, camping, fly fishing and watching football. 

Cheers!

name: Modern guesthouse in Bozeman
description:
A beautiful apartment with all the amenities for your stay here in Bozeman. It is situated above our detached garage, which is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood with several parks, ponds and trails just steps away.
It has a fully equipped kitchen, a/c , heat, washer/dryer, mesh Wi-Fi and a 55" smart TV. The bedroom is small but cozy with a memory foam queen bed.
We live on property so feel free to reach out with any question or needs you may have.

name: Riverside Townhome
description:
Recently renovated townhome in the Riverside Subdivision. This townhome has been lovingly renovated and remodeled from top to bottom. Brand new kitchen with butcher block island is fully equipped and ready for easy and convenient food prep. Living room has new gas fireplace and large smart TV. Primary bedroom has king bed and enjoy hot bubbly soaks in the claw foot tub. Second bedroom sleeps 4 in the queen bed with full top bunk.

Patio w/gas grill.
Located 10 minutes from BZN.
30 day rentals

name: Bozeman Bison Bunker - Near Montana State MSU
description: Come be one of the first to stay at our Bozeman Bison Bunker just minutes from Montana State University. With a view of the M and just a 5 minute drive to the University, you won't find a better space during your stay in Bozeman. Enjoy this designer space with 9' kitchen island, 65" Samsung smart tv, and full size washer and dryer. This is a brand new property with stairs above a garage but not sharing any walls with others. We're the owners living in the larger side available to help.
neighborhood_overview: Gran Cielo is the manifestation of our dedication to create community through a common living space. While its million-dollar views, unmatched central park, and easy access to downtown Bozeman and the wild beyond make Gran Cielo an enticing location, it’s the sense of classic community that sets it apart. Whether you’re looking for your first home, a bit more space, or somewhere to settle indefinitely, Gran Cielo offers a sophisticated array of home types, sizes and styles. Unique architectural details and contemporary design draw residents in, but it’s the community’s centerpiece, a world class central park, that draws them together.

name: Historical 2 Bedroom  House Downtown (on Main St.)
description: Originally built in the early 20th century, this historical home has been newly remodeled to fit your needs as you visit Bozeman. Located within walking distance of downtown Bozeman, the Midtown District, and the MSU campus, this home offers a relaxing and accommodating space to recharge as you explore all that Montana has to offer. The west entrance of Yellowstone National Park is open and accessable by way of a scenic 1 hour 45-minute drive through the mountains of Big Sky.
neighborhood_overview:
Right on Main Street this is a centrally located property that is backed by family friendly neighborhood great for strolling and seeing historical Bozeman. Multiple local ice cream shops both within a block of the property. Straight shot to downtown shopping.

Please note that there are tenants who live above the unit.

name: The Bear Den: Downtown Bozeman Penthouse Mtn Views
description:
Come enjoy the ideal base camp: our newly-built, well-appointed condo located within easy walking distance to downtown Bozeman, nestled in Montana's natural beauty.

The “Bear Den” condo is on the top floor and faces south (the quiet side of the building, away from the noise of downtown) for peaceful sunlight and mountain views. It has an upscale, well-stocked gourmet kitchen, an over-size shower, and luxury finishes. Enjoy your view from your private deck and balcony.
neighborhood_overview: In the new SOBO building at 718 W. Babcock St.

name: Bozeman's Main Stay the heart of downtown Bozeman
description: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. We are in the center of Bozeman with  it's wonderful restaurants and amazing downtown. The Bozeman's Main Stay is a historic home built in 1908 and one of a handful of homes still on Main St  We are just a short drive from Bridger Bowl and Big Sky ski resorts, as well as Yellowstone National Park and the world renowned Gallatin river.  Also minutes from the Yellowstone International airport, please come and enjoy.
neighborhood_overview:
Bozeman's main stay is located right on Main Street of Bozeman. We are so very close (just a block or two ) to the downtown area and its many wonderful restaurants and shops. We are also 1 block from The Wilson auditorium Which brings in the Bozeman Symphony and wonderful performances During the holidays.
We look forward to you staying with us.

The Sweet Spot , located in beautiful Bozeman, Montana, is nestled 2 blocks from the hip and historic downtown. Take advantage of this spectacular location with world class recreation just outside your doors, truly the SWEET SPOT. Situated in the heart of this booming Montana town, you’re a quick walk to world class cuisine, shopping and 20 minutes from premier skiing. neighborhood_overview:
Throughout the year, Bozeman is alive with activity. With festivals and outdoor concerts during the summer and endless outdoor summer and winter activities. Enjoy the being minutes away from the top fly fishing in the United States, ski hills, hiking trails, music events or the bustling downtown and get ready to explore! With downtown Bozeman minutes away (walking or driving), you are in the epicenter of Bozeman’s charm and can enjoy this booming little town and all it has to offer.

If you are looking to extend your adventures, you are just a short trip in any direction to the following:

21 min to Bridger Bowl Ski Mountain
90 min to Yellowstone National Park (Entrance)

name: The Bison Abode - Spacious Home 2 Bedrooms
description:
Oh come to this home near where the buffalo roam, whether to work or as home base for play. Where seldom is heard a discouragin' word, and the fireplace is cozy all day.

This spacious, comfortable and well-appointed home in a quiet neighborhood is the perfect abode for your Bozeman visit. Located in the northwest area of Bozeman convenient to the airport, park trails, shopping, restaurants, and breweries. Only 15 minutes to downtown and 25 minutes to Bridger Bowl and Crosscut ski resorts .
neighborhood_overview: Convenient, friendly neighborhood with a park a large regional park just 3 blocks away with walking trails and ponds.
host_about:
Please call me Bob! I am the founder and chief scientist at the Yellowstone Ecological Research Center (YERC). Over my 30-plus years working in the Greater Yellowstone, my research interests have sought a more holistic connection between nature, people, and technology. That’s led to what I call “Adaptive Ecology,” studying not only how ecosystems adapt to changing conditions, but how the science of ecology must adapt to social and technological changes as well. That focus drives YERC’s mission today.

Personally, I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and finding common ground among cultures and communities.  I love sharing my knowledge of the Greater Yellowstone area and ecology, the best places to spot local wildlife, and my favorite watering holes in the area.

name: Victorian Stay, Cannery District, Downtown Bozeman
description: This is the perfect basecamp for folks looking for a few nights or extended stay in the heart of the Cannery District, walking distance to historic downtown Bozeman. The spacious 4 bed/2 bath Victorian home sits on 2.5 city lots on a dead end street flanked by mature lilac bushes, maximizing privacy. The back patio has a private outdoor seating area, perfect for relaxing after an active day. Coffee shops, breweries and a live music recording studio are just blocks away.
host_about:
Howdy! Welcome to Montana. I was born and raised on a working horse ranch in the heart of Paradise Valley, specifically Tom Miner Basin along the banks of the Yellowstone River. My parents continue to thrive on the ranch while my siblings and I went out into the world to pursue educations and other interests. My love for Montana brought me home in 2012, when I launched my vacation rental management business- MonTanya Yellowstone Properties & Concierge.

I'm based in Livingston and look forward to welcoming and accommodating you in southwest Montana.

description: Nestled within the Rocky Mountains lies this 4-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom vacation rental home. Spend your mornings working up a sweat in the home gym before preparing a delicious breakfast with your loved ones. Then, head back in time and visit the Museum of the Rockies, home to the world's largest collection of North American dinosaur fossils. Return home to relax on the patio by the fireplace and enjoy good company before heading inside and getting a good night’s sleep. The options are endless!
neighborhood_overview:
ATTRACTIONS: Montana Science Center (3.2 miles), Emerson Center for the Arts & Culture (4.3 miles), Bozeman Sculpture Park (4.7 miles), American Computer & Robotics Museum (4.9 miles), Museum of the Rockies (5.5 miles)
HIKING: Gallagator Trail (4.8 miles), Drinking Horse Mountain Trailhead (6.7 miles), Painted Trail Access (8.7 miles), Mt. Ellis Trailhead (12.5 miles)
GONE FISHING: Montana Guided Fly Fishing, LLC. (1.4 miles), Montana Angling Company (4.0 miles), Cherry River Fishing Access (4.1 miles), Campbell’s Guided Fishing Trips (4.3 miles)
AIRPORT: Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport BZN (7.9 miles)

name: Luxury Studio in desirable Bozeman neighborhood
description: With an open floor plan, it has a full living, dining, and kitchen great room space, plus a generous bedroom, bathroom and laundry area. neighborhood_overview: We are located in Valley West, an award winning family friendly planned community that has parks, walking trails, a lake with a pavilion and a playground all within walking distance. Also within walking distance is The Market at Ferguson Farm boasting four of Bozeman's favorite restaurants. Our location gives easy access to Big Sky/Moonlight Basin skiing or Bozeman's own Bridger Bowl; we are 88 miles from West Yellowstone, and less than a block away from a Streamline bus stop, Bozeman's free bus service.
