name: Mountain Coffee
description:
Centrally located in Gallatin County, 60 minutes to Big Sky Resort, 30 minutes to Bridger Bowl, 10 minutes to downtown Bozeman, 10 minutes to Montana State University, walking distance to shops and restaurants on the growing west side of town.
Take a break between adventures to take advantage of the full coffee bar or take a nap on the premium king size bed. My garage is full of tuning equipment and extra gear, if you think you need something I'm happy to help.
neighborhood_overview:
Valley West is a great neighborhood on the west side of town with in walking distance to The Ridge ( a gym), a juice bar, a yoga studio, Polar Brewing ( brewery), restaurants Tanglewood, Sidewinders, Hachi Sushi, Foxtrot (also a coffee stop) .
The neighborhood is mostly full of families.
There is a nice mature tress and custom houses to enjoy a walk around with a cup of coffee. If you go a block east you will find a large pond full of ducks along with a community park with walking trails.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Airy & spacious top floor suite
description: Our most spacious space will give you lots of elbow room. This room has a private bath with a cast iron tub, a sitting room with a couch and 65" TV, and also an adjustable sit/stand desk. It's got everything you need to make your Bozeman base your combination of relaxing and productive.
neighborhood_overview:
The Northeast Neighborhood or the Brewery District, as it’s labeled on some maps, has a lot of history, a central location, and still has two active breweries. The original brewery, which is long since gone, was owned by the family who built their residence across the street in 1897. This house still stands today on our property as a private residence.

Today there are a lot of activities in the direct neighborhood and lots more in walking distance on Main Street. Near the Garden House you'll find Treeline Coffee, Wild Crumb Bakery, Fink's Deli, Mischa's Market, Mountains Walking Brewpub, and Bozone Brewing's tap room. There's someone delicious available at most hours of the day.

description: A fun-filled retreat awaits anglers, skiers, and outdoor adventurers at this fabulous vacation rental in Bozeman! name: Little Yellow House - Heart of Downtown Bozeman
description: Welcome to our cheerful, warm and cozy "little yellow house" located in the historic Cooper Park neighborhood in the heart of Bozeman. Take in peaceful vibes from the surrounding nature and parks--all within a 5-minute walk to central downtown and a short drive to Bridger Bowl ski area, Hyalite Canyon, the Madison River and many other outdoor recreation destinations. Cared for by 2 Super Hosts, you are sure to have the best stay possible!
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in the Cooper Park Historic District, which includes Colonial Revival, Bungalow/craftsman, and Queen Anne architecture. The streets are lined with trees and cute bungalows, most of which are pre-war built.
host_about: Hi! I'm originally from Texas, now living in Montana, working as a documentary photographer. I've traveled all over the world and have lived in Turkey, India, Iraq, and Afghanistan. I love traveling, meeting new people and trying new things. I have been a host and guest on airbnb since 2010, and have had some amazing experiences. I'm very clean and respectful, and I take care of other's homes like they were my own. I look forward to hosting you and / or staying at your home!

name: South Tracy Craftsman House in Historic Bozeman
description: South Tracy Craftsman House is located in the historic district of downtown Bozeman with its century old homes. Enjoy the 5 block walk to downtown with all its amenities: bistros, breweries and bars. Restaurants to please every pallet, from BBQ to gourmet. Coffee shops, theaters, galleries and summertime Music on Main and Farmers Market events. Walk Peets Hill, the Elm and Museum of the Rockies. Drive to Big Sky, Bridger Ski Mountain and Yellowstone Park.
host_about: I have lived in the Gallatin Valley for over 25 years and love the things that it has to offer from hiking, skiing, biking, restaurants and music. I am happy to share information about any of them.

name: The Architect's Annex
description: Enjoy a stylish experience nestled below the Bridger Mountains, yet up among the aspen trees in the Historic District of Bozeman's Northeast Neighborhood. Located on a quiet street with breweries, restaurants, and galleries within a stone’s throw. The heart of Main Street is only a couple of blocks away. name: Modern Luxury at Bozeman Pond
description: Welcome to your luxury home away from home.  This brand-new condo is situated near the shoreline of Bozeman Pond.  It's the perfect place for a family or a group:  Each of the three bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom.  The primary suite features a king size bed, private balcony, two-sided fireplace, and a soaking tub with mountain views.  The great room boasts a chef's kitchen, a giant living room with a gas fireplace, and a second-story patio gazing out at the Bridger mountains.
neighborhood_overview:
Bridger Vale is a brand-new development on Bozeman's north side. So new, in fact, that it is still under construction. While our home is completely finished, there are other buildings adjacent to us that are still actively being built. As such, you can expect construction noises, crews, and a little extra mud from April until September 2023.

Beyond the construction, this neighborhood is home to "Bozeman Beach," also known as Glen Lake Rotary Park. This popular pond is bustling in the summer with swimmers, paddle-boarders, small watercraft, beach volleyball, and more. Across the pond or a short drive away, you'll find MAP Brewing and the other amenities available in this neighborhood.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Parkside Paradise at Gran Cielo
description:
Welcome to your Parkside Paradise at Gran Cielo! This one-of-a-kind accommodation is the perfect choice for travelers who want to experience something truly special during their stay.

From the moment you step inside, you'll be immersed in a world of artistic inspiration and imagination. The interior of the rental is decorated with vibrant colors, intricate patterns, and unique furnishings that reflect the creativity and passion of artist/owners.
host_about:
Family. Friends. Mountains. Skiing. Real Estate. Photography. Big Adventures. 

Relationships are the most important thing in life, and time spent with friends and family is what I live for. The number of great friends that I met because of Airbnb is an ever-growing list that can no longer can be counted with just fingers and toes. 

Being a host has allowed me to travel and meet others without ever boarding a plane. It is a beautiful thing for me to learn about my guests and share my love for Big Sky and the mountains with them. 

And I believe that in all things, aesthetics matter.

name: The Executive Downtown Bozeman Studio
description: Experience downtown Bozeman, Montana at this centrally-located executive suite. This fully furnished studio is perfect, walking distance to restaurants, the post office, banks, shopping, coffee shops, and more. Only a 4-minute drive to Montana State University. Fully furnished with a well-stocked kitchen, washer/dryer, dedicated workspace, lounge area, and a comfortable bed. You'll feel relaxed and refreshed after a great night's sleep at The Executive. neighborhood_overview:
South of Main Street filled with some of Bozeman’s most historic residences. Quiet streets lined with mature trees and towering Victorian-era homes distinguish this neighborhood. Residences are generally on smaller lots, with many having multiple units and shared back alley access. The Gallagator Linear Trail meanders throughout, connecting neighbors from Main Street to Kagy.

Great for those that want to stay in historic “old Bozeman” and be within walking distance from farmer’s markets and downtown events.

1-4 minutes to downtown

name: Camp Coffee
description:
This is a great space for a Basecamp to your outdoor adventures here in Bozeman. Whether it’s skiing, fishing, or visiting family.
There’s extra space in the garage for storage or gear repairs.
I’m happy to give recommendations on the local attractions.
The room is spacious with a plush king sized bed and up stairs away from the main area in a shared home so you can expect a lot of privacy.
There’s also a set of friendly yet shy retired sled dogs around from time to time.

This is a quiet neighborhood full of families and mature landscaping making it a great place to walk with a cup of coffee.
There is a pond just a block east with a large park to enjoy one a walk.

Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting.

I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Downtown Dream house
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located home. Lots of space both inside and out. Lovely yard with fire pit, a front porch with rockers, and a breeze way for easy dry access to the kitchen or a great place to grill and hang out. Walk to campus and town from this convenient location.

3 bedrooms, two up and one down, 2 full baths w/towels etc, kitchen, dining-room and livingroom have loads of windows. Stone fireplace adds extra charm.
host_about:
I have had my home and cottage in Bozeman for over 20 years. During that time our family lived abroad in Lugano, Switzerland, and then Surrey, England for over 9 years, returning to our home once or twice a year to stay in touch with lovely Bozeman and our wonderful local friends. We are originally from Connecticut and have lots of family there that we visit regularly. I’ve been back in Bozeman full time for about 8 years and love all the many activities MT has to offer including skiing, snow shoeing, hiking, cycling, camping, tennis, pickleball, yoga  and so much more. 

I have two sons, one who graduated from the US Naval Academy Annapolis and is now a Marine Officer stationed at Camp Lejeune in North Carolina. The other graduated from University College London, England Medical School and is currently working as a doctor in London and is a competitive rower. 

I’m busy managing my rental properties located on the edge of the MSU campus and our lovely Yellow Dogs guest Cottage along with working as a Property Manager for others. 

Our Yellow Dogs are named Rumo & Tater.  You will occasionally see them playing and chasing balls in the fenced in backyard.

We are positioned just three blocks off of Bozeman’s vibrant downtown area and a mile off of I-90 offering a convenient location no matter your adventure. We strive to offer some of the most competitive rates while providing high-quality service and accommodations, allowing each of our guests a memorable stay for a great value.

name: Gorgeous, Modern Apt in coveted Valley West
description:
Lakefront Bozeman apartment in Valley West with a full kitchen
Beautiful, private apartment for rent in the coveted Valley West neighborhood! This stunning, state-of-the-art apartment is only a half block from the park, pond, and trail system. With a private deck and BBQ, a Plush King-sized bed, a washer-dryer, and a gorgeous, usable kitchen, this is the perfect short-term home for anyone seeking a tranquil getaway.
neighborhood_overview:
Kitchens offer refrigerators, stovetops, microwaves, and cookware/dishes/utensils. Bathrooms include shower/tub combinations. Housekeeping is provided on request.
The recreational activities listed below are available either on site or nearby; fees may apply.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Cooper Park Nest 1-Month Min
description: Brand new construction, 5 Blocks from the core of Downtown Bozeman and next to our beautiful Cooper Park. Central AC. 30 day minimum mid term rental.
host_about:
I started Bozeman Cottage Vacation Rentals in 1998 which has now grown to 17 properties, mostly within walking distance from downtown Bozeman. I also work in renewable energy - solar thermal, permaculture, electric bikes, and biofuels - and strive to keep Bozeman Cottage low impact.  I stock the houses with non-toxic body products and cleaners, and are as efficient as possible with heating and cooling.  I also run a bicycle rental business so you can easily and affordably see Bozeman on 2-wheels!

Note: I manage a few different guest houses and reviews are shown collectively for all places. The few reservations that had to be cancelled over the years were mostly due to date conflicts when calendars failed to update automatically. The July 2016 reservation was cancelled when the guests revealed that they had two cats after using autobook, for which Airbnb charged me 100, so unfortunately I no longer use autobook.

name: Cozy brewery district bungalow
description: This historic home in downtown, just three blocks from Main Street,  is walking distance to all of the great breweries, restaurants and coffee shops.  We have a stylish space that is inviting and fun. Family friendly open floor plan makes entertaining easy and updated master bedroom with ensuite bathroom offer a quiet and comfortable place to rest. Great front porch and spacious back yard and deck for hanging out and taking in Bozeman's best neighborhood!  City of Bozeman Permit #STR23-00094
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of northeast Bozeman, walking distance to the tons of delicious food.  For breakfast, head to Wild Crumb bakery, Fink's delicatessen, or the Western Cafe.  For lunch, grab a pint at Bozeman Brewing Co. or Mountains Walking for wood fired pizza.  The classic Montana Aleworks is just at the end of the block for dinner.

name: Your Downtown Urban Sanctuary: Walk to everything!
description:
Discover serenity at the NamaStay Condo Retreat, a haven of tranquility nestled in the heart of Beautiful Downtown Bozeman, Montana. Immerse yourself in a space thoughtfully adorned with a yoga-inspired touches, offering luxury and comfort for a truly rejuvenating escape. Just moments away from vibrant Main Street, NamaStay invites you to explore the city's delightful array of eateries, boutiques, artistic gems, and vibrant nightlife. Embrace the perfect union of urban convenient.
STR23-00086
neighborhood_overview: Bozeman is referred to as one of the “most livable places” for good reason! It is surrounded by mountains and rivers and offers unending opportunities no matter what time of year it is. Located in the heart of Downtown Bozeman, VRBozeman's properties offer something for everyone. In the warmer months you can explore the mountains, fly fish on world renowned rivers and streams, mountain bike on miles of trails and enjoy several other outdoor activities. In the winter you are 45 minutes from the largest ski resort in America, Big Sky and 15 minutes from the local hill Bridger Bowl. There is Nordic skiing, snow shoeing, ice climbing, hunting, snowmobiling and much more. If you need a break from the outdoors don’t fret. Bozeman has amazing eateries, shops, nightlife and offers a rich arts and cultural experience with a number of galleries, museums and historical points of interest. This area is perfect for a family getaway, a romantic vacation, or even a solo trip. Come and explore all tha

Unwritten & Company | Reservations & Guest Services 

At your service,

VR Bozeman | Vacation Rentals
A Beautiful Way To Stay!

name: Airy Southside Guest Suite near MSU
description:
This bright and spacious guest suite sleeps 4 and is located in a lovely, quiet neighborhood on Bozeman's south side near MSU, downtown, and the Museum of the Rockies.

It's the perfect basecamp. Enjoy a comfortable bed, a hot shower, and a cup of coffee and a bagel before heading out for a day outdoors. Or, take advantage of the dedicated workspace looking out into the lawn, the high-speed internet, and the proximity to Bozeman's attractions. This is a safe neighborhood with parks nearby.
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in a beautiful residential neighborhood just 1.8 miles south of the Museum of the Rockies and MSU. There are multiple parks and walking trails nearby. The area has mature trees, manicured lawns, and families.

name: House Blend
description:
Welcome to my home! This is my primary residence most of the year so you will notice not only personal touches but that the property is well cared for. It is spacious and filled with premium beds and bedding for a good nights sleep.
Located on the West side of town you are 30 Minutes to Bridger Bowl, 60 minutes to Big Sky Resort, 10 Minutes to downtown Bozeman and MSU, and an hour and a half to the North Entrance of Yellow Stone National Park.
-Mi casa es su casa-
neighborhood_overview: This is quiet family neighborhood with a wonderful park and pond just down the block with is great for a stroll. Enjoy walking through mature trees and the uniqueness of each home.
host_about:
Hello! I moved to Bozeman after college and stayed for the skiing and the community that I've built here the last 18 years. I enjoy hockey, skiing, snowboarding, mountain biking and rafting. 
For work I am a Vacation Rental Real Estate Investor and Construction Remodeler. 
I grew up in Idaho about 5 hours from here.
In the fall I love to make a nice breakfast and watch College Game day to hear about all the college football games.

name: Queen bed, Downtown, Workspace, Fast Wi-Fi
description:
Looking for an affordable but central place to stay in Bozeman? Within 5 blocks, you can access Main Street, Peet's Hill, Bogert Park, Lindley Park, the library, and more!

This shared basement apartment offers you a private room while sharing the kitchen, bathroom, and living room with two other private rooms.

Early check-in available & a no-chore checkout!!
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located within walking distance, you'll find Bogert and Lindley Parks, where all the summer festivals come to life. Additionally, Pete's Hill and its extensive network of over 80 miles of trails are easily accessible. Bozeman Public Library, downtown with its array of shops, bars, and restaurants, as well as public transport options to Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, are all just a short stroll away.
host_about: I am from Bozeman but am well travelled and sociable. I like music, art, languages, cultures, group meals, fireside chats....etc and so on.

name: Charming and Cozy 3BR in the Heart of Bozeman
description: This home is located about 1 mile from the historic downtown of Bozeman, MT. It is also a short 1.5 mile distance from the heart of the MSU campus. Stay here and enjoy all that Bozeman has to offer with great food/breweries, world renowned fly fishing, hiking, mountain biking, hunting, skiing (Big Sky/Bridger Bowl), backcountry exploring, and Yellowstone National Park.
neighborhood_overview: This house is located in Walton Homestead built in 2004. It’s a newer subdivision just a short walk to Bozeman High School and surrounding businesses.
host_about:
I live and work in Bozeman, MT. This town is growing, however, still has a small community feel. Many of us around here know eachother.  I love to share all that Bozeman has to offer while preserving it’s beautiful environment.  I put a lot of work into my house to be able to share it with you. I hope you like it and enjoy your stay.
Wendy

name: Luxury Mountain Views Downtown Bozeman
description:
Welcome to our exquisite luxury townhome in the heart of Bozeman, Montana, where modern comfort meets the rugged beauty of the Big Sky State. This newly constructed 4-bedroom, 4-bathroom haven is the perfect retreat for those seeking an authentic modern Montana living experience.


STR23-00099
neighborhood_overview:
Step outside, and you'll discover your own private outdoor oasis. The townhome is nestled adjacent to the tranquil Glen Lake Rotary Park, offering a serene backdrop to your Montana escape. Spend your mornings sipping coffee on the deck, listening to the sounds of nature, or fire up the grill for a delicious barbecue while taking in the stunning surroundings.

For outdoor enthusiasts, this property is a dream come true. With immediate access to hiking and biking trails, you can explore the beauty of Montana right from your doorstep. In the winter, nearby skiing and snowboarding opportunities await in the Bridger Mountains, providing year-round adventure.

Stephanie + Josiah

name: Downtown Bozeman Studio Spot
description:
Centrally located in downtown Bozeman, MT. This studio space in our home is 10 minutes from the airport, 5 minutes from Montana State University and groceries are within walking distance. The beloved downtown Bozeman is right outside the door with shops and world class restaurants within a 5 minute walk.
This space is shared with born and raised locals who can tell you all the best secrets this valley has to offer. You have your own private space much like a hotel room with a private full bath.

name: Pagoda Peaks - Panoramic Mountain Views
description:
This stunning home at Bridger Vale offers luxurious accommodations for short-term stays. Large enough for a family yet romantic enough for a couple, this gorgeous condo will be a tranquil respite after exploring all that Bozeman has to offer.

Located just past the shoreline of Glen Lake Rotary Park, known to locals as "Bozeman Beach," this three-story home features panoramic views from three separate terraces.
neighborhood_overview:
This home is new, well-appointed, and in a fabulous location.

Bozeman Beach is adjacent for endless fun. The house is stocked with umbrellas, games, lawn chairs, coolers, and thermacells for guest use. The popular MAP brewing company is just across the pond, and many restaurants and shops are nearby at the Cannery District and Downtown Bozeman.

Pagoda Peaks is 2.5 miles from downtown Bozeman, 16 miles to Bridger Bowl Ski Area, 52 miles to Big Sky Resort, and 90 miles to Yellowstone National Park.

The area features endless hiking and mountain biking trails, blue-ribbon trout streams, and Nordic and Alpine Ski areas.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Main Street Mountain View
description:
Main Street Mountain View is a place we have done our best to create a feeling of luxury and comfort. There are two bedrooms and two bathrooms, along with a large room that encompasses the kitchen, dining room and living room. The private deck allows views of Main Street and the Bridgers. If you need to do laundry there is a private laundry room in the unit to care for all your washing needs.
Our hope is that you are confident in being able to relax when you come to Main Street Mountain View.

name: Bridger Hawk - Mid-Century Classic (NEW)
description: Discover Bozeman's charm from our mid-century 3BR, 2BA home! Minutes from downtown, with Bridger Mountain views, indulge in luxury with hotel-style amenities, a wood fireplace, and comfy beds. Enjoy a spacious backyard & garage—perfect for snowy days. Close to nature & city delights, it’s a haven for relaxation and adventure. Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or an exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for your MT journey.
neighborhood_overview:
Beyond the confines of this home away from home, Bozeman's cultural and natural treasures await. Find yourself just minutes from artisan boutiques, eclectic eateries, and buzzing nightlife downtown. Or answer the call of the wild as you venture into the mountain trails, picturesque hikes, and panoramic vistas of the Bridgers.

Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or a comprehensive exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for a journey steeped in comfort and style. The soul of the past meets the spirit of the present, right here, beneath the vast Montana skies. Welcome home!

STR23-00019
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled within a quaint development of 20 recently built luxury townhomes, our residence offers a prime location directly opposite Glen Rotary Lake. This picturesque lake provides a gateway to various recreational activities such as fishing, swimming, and kayaking. The surrounding area features a scenic walking path encircling the lake, leading conveniently to the MAP Brewing Company—a fantastic spot for dining, drinks, and live music. Step out the back door, and you'll discover an extensive network of hiking and biking trails that wind their way alongside the scenic East Gallatin River.

Within walking distance, you'll also find Gildhouse Suites, a venue that houses a delightful coffee shop and a comprehensive salon/spa experience.

The convenience continues with our home being just minutes away from downtown Bozeman, while a short 20-minute drive takes you to the slopes of Bridger Ski Resort. Enjoy the perfect blend of tranquility and accessibility at our locatio
host_about: Hello! Thank you for considering a stay at our home! We are an active family that loves to travel. We also love hosting fellow travelers! We are available for questions 8am-6pm MST or in case of emergency.

name: Nostalgic Homestead on South Yellowstone
description:
Welcome home to this cozy, spacious retreat in Bozeman, Montana!

This four-bedroom, three-bathroom home is large enough for the whole family. Featuring five queen beds and two living rooms, you can invite everyone!
neighborhood_overview: The location is perfectly situated in a residential area of Bozeman.  Less than a mile to Gallatin Valley Mall and Whole Foods. 2.7 miles to downtown Bozeman. 10 miles to the airport, 20 miles to Bridger Bowl, 47 miles to Big Sky Resort, and 90 miles to Yellowstone National Park.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Bridger Hawk Suite (NEW)
description: A stone's throw from downtown Bozeman, the Bridger Hawk suite is a mid-century basement apartment blending retro charm with modern comforts. It sleeps four, with a queen bed and sleeper sofa, and features a fully equipped kitchen, high-speed WiFi, and a flat-screen TV. Enjoy privacy, free parking, and easy access to Bozeman's attractions. A perfect retreat after exploring the city or the great outdoors. The suite is a basement apartment of the Bridger Hawk Mid-Century Classic home.
neighborhood_overview:
Beyond the confines of this home away from home, Bozeman's cultural and natural treasures await. Find yourself just minutes from artisan boutiques, eclectic eateries, and buzzing nightlife downtown. Or answer the call of the wild as you venture into the mountain trails, picturesque hikes, and panoramic vistas of the Bridgers.

Whether you're here for a weekend getaway or a comprehensive exploration of Bozeman's charm, this mid-century marvel stands ready to become your personal basecamp for a journey steeped in comfort and style. The soul of the past meets the spirit of the present, right here, beneath the vast Montana skies. Welcome home!
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Modern Bozeman Escape w/ Bridger Mountain Views!
description: Experience a trip to Montana from this spacious 4-bedroom, 4-bath townhome with stunning mountain views. Located a few miles from downtown Bozeman and close to outdoor adventures, this vacation rental is the perfect home base. Walk to the waterfront at Glen Rotary Park, hit the slopes at Bridger Bowl Ski Area, or spend a day exploring Yellowstone National Park. After a day of adventure, relax by the fireplace or gather around the dining table for a memorable evening with family and friends.
neighborhood_overview:
DOWNTOWN SITES (~2 miles): Bozeman Co-op West Main, Emerson Center for the Arts & Culture, Willson Auditorium, Gallatin History Museum, City of Bozeman Bogert Park, Peets Hill/Burke Park, Lindley Park, Gallagator Trail, shops, restaurants, cafes, lounges
OUTDOOR RECREATION: Glen Rotary Park (on-site), Bridger Creek Golf Course (2 miles), Gallatin County Regional Park (4 miles), Montana Grizzly Encounter (14 miles), Bridger Bowl Ski Area (16 miles), Custer Gallatin National Forest (66 miles), Yellowstone National Park (80 miles)
FAMILY ATTRACTIONS: Bozeman Brewery Historic District (2 miles), Montana State University (3 miles), Museum of the Rockies (4 miles)
AIRPORT: Bozeman Yellowstone International Airport (9 miles)

Centered between the 7th street corridor and the heart of downtown, making this the perfect location for restaurants, coffee shops, music, nightlife, shopping and more! Close to skiing, hiking, fishing, hot springs and short drive to YNP. This newly remodeled contemporary space sleep 6 guests with a pull out queen bed.  See all that Bozeman has to offer!
neighborhood_overview: 5 minute walking distance to the heart of downtown Bozeman.  Perfect for concerts at the ELM, Sweat Pea Festival, the Christmas Stroll and other downtown events.

name: Sunlit Cottage on Curtiss
description:
Nestled in an incredible location near the Co-Op, this snug spot offers a warm and inviting haven while visiting Bozeman. Enjoy the convenience of off-street parking, a full bathroom, and a well-equipped kitchen.

Whether you're in town to ski, fish, hike, bike, visit the university, work, or just check out downtown, this cottage's location puts you close enough to the action while being far enough away to enjoy the quiet of a residential neighborhood.
neighborhood_overview:
The best thing about this cottage is the location! You're three blocks from Cooper Park, a wonderfully walkable neighborhood park with mature trees, picnic tables, friendly dogs, and students playing frisbee. It's a great place for a stroll or a picnic.

Four blocks north, you'll reach the Bozeman Community Food Co-op where you can find local, organic produce and grocery staples, plus a fantastic hot bar, grab-and-go food options, fresh flowers, toiletries, and more.

You're a half-mile walk to Starbucks or Maven's Market, a gourmet cheese, sandwich, and gelato shop. Grab a bite on your walk to downtown Bozeman's unique, locally-owned boutiques, bars, and restaurants.
host_about: Hi, I’m Tessa. Originally from Missouri, I’ve been in Bozeman since 2010. I'm a mom and Licensed Montana Property Manager (RRE-RPM-LIC-109282).  My husband, Sten, is an Architect. We adore Bozeman and love sharing it with our guests. We love hiking, biking, skiing, camping, riding motorcycles, traveling near and far, and meeting new people. We share our home with our two young children.

name: Southbridge Cottage: Cozy and Modern Home (NEW)
description: This fabulous, single level, 3 bedroom, 2 bath house is great for everyone! The open floor plan combines the dining, kitchen, and living room with large windows and plenty of natural light. This cheerful home is located in south Bozeman. Montana State University is just 2 miles away!
neighborhood_overview:
The Southbridge subdivision in Bozeman, Montana, offers a charming and picturesque setting for short-term rental homes, nestled within the stunning natural beauty of the Gallatin Valley. Bozeman itself is a vibrant and thriving city renowned for its unique blend of outdoor adventure, cultural attractions, and small-town charm.

Southbridge is ideally situated just a short distance from downtown Bozeman, providing guests with convenient access to a plethora of dining, shopping, and entertainment options. The subdivision boasts well-maintained streets lined with beautiful homes, offering a tranquil retreat for visitors seeking relaxation and rejuvenation.

Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the abundance of outdoor recreational opportunities available in the surrounding area, including hiking, fishing, skiing, and more. The nearby Bridger Mountains and Gallatin National Forest offer endless opportunities for exploration and adventure, making Southbridge an ideal desti
host_about:
We love being outdoors.  We live to travel.  We believe riches come from experiences, not things. 
It is important to us to live everyday to the fullest, because you never know what’s around the corner. We love adventure, travel, great food and good friends, preferably all at once. What we're after can't be purchased.
 
We are blessed with five children.  We love Montana.

name: Townhome 1st floor bed + bath
description:
Come stay in a modern, warm and private first floor bed + small bath. You'll have access to the fully stocked (shared) kitchen upstairs as well.

The space
Your bedroom and bath is located on the 1st floor. The bed is queen sized. The electric fire is cozy. The bath is stocked with essentials, including a hair dryer. The bathroom is smaller (think 1 person at a time) type of space, but modern! We're located in a modern townhome community 10 min drive to downtown Bozeman. 3 minute drive to MSU.
neighborhood_overview: A quiet family oriented neighborhood in a townhome setting.
host_about:
Hello! My name is Lindsay and I live in Bozeman but am originally from coastal Massachusetts. I joined Airbnb to travel freely, and also host guests in my townhome in Montana. I enjoy meeting new people, experiencing adventure, and all things health/wellness related. I work full time remote as a senior product designer in fintech.

As a host: My priority is providing a quiet, comfortable, safe and stylish space for guests while they visit Bozeman.

As a guest: Treating ones home as if it were my own, with respect.

name: Cute Condo Near Downtown & Parks
description: Centrally located and clean space right off South Willson Avenue. Six blocks from Montana State University, twelve blocks to downtown, and backing to the Langohr Garden Park/Gallagator Trail System. name: Spacious Bozeman 3-BedRoom Getaway with Fast Wi-Fi
description:
Experience all Bozeman has to offer from the comfort of your own private 3-bedroom apartment!
This centrally located, lower-level unit puts you within 5 blocks of Main Street, Peet's Hill, Bogert Park, Lindley Park, the library, and more.
Ideal for families, friends, or small groups traveling together, this spacious apartment offers the privacy of individual bedrooms while sharing a fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and living room.

Book your stay today and create lasting memories in Bozeman!
neighborhood_overview: Conveniently located within walking distance, you'll find Bogert and Lindley Parks, where all the summer festivals come to life. Additionally, Pete's Hill and its extensive network of over 80 miles of trails are easily accessible. Bozeman Public Library, downtown with its array of shops, bars, and restaurants, as well as public transport options to Bridger Bowl and Big Sky, are all just a short stroll away.
host_about: I am from Bozeman but am well travelled and sociable. I like music, art, languages, cultures, group meals, fireside chats....etc and so on.
